title: It is unclear where Battye’s property was located. Regarding Company houses in Russia at this time, see Arel, “Muscovy Company”, chapter 7. Russian grants in the late sixteenth century allowed the Company to establish houses on the Moscow-Archangel route and in Kolmogory, Vologda, Iaroslavl’, and Moscow. By 1567 the grant was extended to Novgorod, Pskov, Ivangorod, and Karel as well as to the Khanates of Kazan and Astrakhan
